page.title: 16A Fruit Farm in Gnosall
page.content: Just outside Gnosall there is a fruit farm where they grow strawberries and gooseberries.There are 60 acres of strawberries and 25 acres of gooseberries The strawberry plants are planted in October but this year they have planted new ones in August. The plants are watered by irrigation if the weather is dry,especially after planting,and are sprayed to get rid of the weeds and insects,also with pig manure.Slug pellets are put down.The strawberries are picked in the summer,startng in July.Between 200 and 400 pickers come in cars,on bicycles,by bus or walk.{every day except Saturday}They start at 7a.m. and pick until 4p.m.The farmer clears the field,has his tea and loads the strawberries into refrigerated lorries. They go all over the country,and abroad,as far as Sweden.
